name: Holiday Inn Express Sacramento Convention Center

reviews.text: This hotel is the best kept secret in Sacramento. By far one of the best hotel values I have ever come across. I try to stay here every time I'm in Sacramento on business. It doesn't look fancy from the outside but the lobby, rooms, hallways and breakfast room are very nice and new. The rooms are sparkling clean. You can't beat the downtown location..restraunts, bars and a Starbucks are near by. The service at the front desk is world class. Kudos to the staff and management for what I consider one of the best businesspersons hotel in California.
reviews.title: No frills 5 star hotel cloaked in a 3 star rating.

reviews.text: Average quality hotel. Definitely, its downtown location is an advantage. Rooms could be cleaner and less outdated. Although breakfest was influded, it was not easy to find something to eat which was not greasy; furthermore, I've got bored being offered exactly the same food each of my 5 days there. Some of the staff were friendly, but some not. Additionally, they have charged my credit card twice!
reviews.title: average quality for good price

reviews.text: This was a great find in terms of value. It is walking distance to convention center and all the state office buildings and Capitol. Staff was very friendly. The room was clean and ample space for 1 or 2 (I had a single King bed). Internet connection was strong and fast enough so I could attend a webex session without any audio/video feed problems. The complimentary breakfast was actually pretty good offering a variety of foods, fruits, yogurts, cereals, etc. They also have a reasonable fitness area with treadmill, etc. The one ding I would give this hotel is their lack of a secured area for checked bags. I arrived very early and they couldn't get me in a room right away (they tried) so they said I could leave my bags in a open area next to the front desk and no claim check was "needed". I left my suitcase but took my electronics because I wasn't comfortable with that set-up. All in all this is a good value, clean hotel and I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel for price range; everything you need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a whim to take part in some St. Pats day celebrations. Made the res while sitting in the parking lot. Holiday Inn central reservations wanted 175.00 A call to the hotel directly got us 129.00. Clean, a huge breakfast room, good selection, gross powdered eggs like every mid range hotel. Fridge in the room. Very friendly desk clerks. Easy walk to convention center and gov. mansion, and bar/restaurants. Had a drink at a place called the Porch. Would definately eat there sometime. Surrounded by 3 motels, an econo lodge and 2 indy's. They appeared sub par but prob costs much less.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: A nice place to stay. Rooms were clean and quiet. Plenty of parking and it is an easy walk to the convention center. The breakfast was good. The hotel offered a variety of food for breakfast. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How many times haven't you searched for an available electrical outlet near the bed, only to find none? Well, this hotel gets it. On both sides of the bed there were two outlets in the lamp, plus one side had an additional hub with three more outlets!
reviews.title: They get it!

reviews.text: This is an older hotel, but nicely refurbished. Parking is free. We walked from the Amtrak station - took maybe twenty minutes. The breakfast area was the nicest I've seen in a HI Express. Food was fresh and plentiful.
reviews.title: Great breakfast

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Only complaint was the thin pillows. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: "Another Great Holiday Inn Express"

reviews.text: For the price, this hotel was very good. Very good breakfast included in the room price. Bathrooms were nice and updated. The blackout blinds actually worked: didn't have gaps and didn't let light in. Good value.
reviews.title: Excellent location in downtown sacramento

reviews.text: I'm a Priority Club Rewards member, so all my hotel stays are at IHG properties, specifically at Holiday Inn Express hotels for the price, convenience and dependability-- I have yet to have a bad stay and this hotel, conveniently within walking distance of the Convention Center and great restaurant choices, was no exception. My daughter and I drove up from Fresno to see humorist Garrison Keillor and his "A Prairie Home Companion--Radio Romance" tour show at the Sacramento Community Theater which is located directly behind the Convention Center. We stayed overnight on 7/11, arriving around 4:00 p.m. that afternoon. Check-in was quick and easy, and the front desk staffer was friendly with a ready smile. He even informed me that with this stay I had now reached the next level of membership with the Rewards program, which I was not aware of so it was nice of him to let me know. He also let me know that we were within walking distance of the Community Theater and if we needed recommendations for dinner he'd be more than happy to help. This is the kind of service I've always received at Holiday Inn Express. We went up to our room and about 45 minutes later the gentlemen at the front desk called and asked if everything with the room was to our satisfaction-- of course it was. We enjoyed the evening and the overnight stay, including the breakfast which offers enough choice for even the pickiest eater. My daughter and I are both coffee drinkers and the coffee the Express chain serves is really good! I might add the dining area was very attractive-- the best I've seen thus far at any of the Express's I've stayed (not that the others were bad, it's just that this one stood out). The only down side to the room with this stay-- and this is very minor but I think worth mentioning-- is that we could hear the occupants walking around in the room above us (we were on the third of four floors), and our full size beds were a little firmer than either one of us would've like to have had. In spite of that, I slept pretty well. One more thing I want to mention here-- when I went to shower in the morning, color me stupid but I couldn't turn on the water and thought the faucet was broken. I called the front desk and right away the maintenance person came up and assessed the situation. The problem: I wasn't pulling the handle out far enough to turn the water on. I had initially tried to do that but apparently I didn't pull on the handle hard enough. The technician said that he'd come back later and would lubricant the component to make it easier to pull the handle out, as it was somewhat tight. He couldn't have been more nice or professional about my "brain fart" lol. This was my first time at this Express and I don't know when I'll be back but again, this stay was what I come to expect at Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Near downtown SAC, but on the borderline.

reviews.text: For those who have read my other entries i have gone through a divorce. these entries will be from a single mans eyes. I recently went to Sacramento to have some fun over the weekend with some friends. I was able to book a room for under $100 that same day. After arriving the gentle man at the counter was very helpful. He was able to answer all my questions and even able to get me a cab ride with minutes after asking. The room was perfect, it was updated and had everything I needed for that night. The location is awesome for those who are looking for a night out. It is only a few blocks away from there down town night life. Cab was 8 dollars with tip. The cafeteria was the first place I met with friends. Very nice restaurant and literally in the same structure was a club called park. This place was crawling with women. When walked to other dive bars and ended up at a lounge called The Mix. This place was very nice but over crowded with guys. They should do ratio control at the door. The lounge is well known and a place to return in the summer. Back to the hotel. The hotel offers free breakfast until 10 am and it was ok. Great for being free but I can not complain. They had a buffet of pancakes, bagels, eggs, etc. I definitely would return here. Thumbs up holiday inn express. Off to San Francisco!
reviews.title: Perfect place for what you pay.

reviews.text: My first time at this hotel, I have been at this version of Holiday Inn accomodations, most of them very good. This particular location has been improved not only by being a newly remodel or built, but the best improvement comes by the employees. All of them are very professional and accomodating, or try to do better for the guest. This single factor for anyone who travels often is well appreciated. Very close to restaurants, coffee shops, convention center, historic landmarks, entreteinment, etc. Sure enough, try to repeat my trip and they are booked for my new dates. I will stay there again, and again if they keep this level of service. Congratulations to all personnel.
reviews.title: Business and pleasure short trip

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel overnight while on my way to Lake Tahoe. I bid on this hotel through Priceline and got a very good deal ($52). My expectation was pretty low because of the price but was pleasantly surprised. Everything was pretty decent. The front entrance looked a little run-down but once you got passed the elevators things started to look a lot better. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom looked like it could use some updating and the tub was a little discolored but nothing that the average person would find intolerable. The free breakfast buffet was very nice. The pancake maker was the best part! Oh, and the breakfast attendant was very friendly and helpful All in all, it definitely served its purpose plus a little extra. I would recommend this hotel to someone looking for a nice place to stay in Sacramento on a limited budget. Happy Travels!
reviews.title: Pretty decent for the price

reviews.text: I stay at Holiday Inn frequently as I travel for business often. Holiday Inn has become my favorite chain as I can always count on their staff to be courteous and professional, and the facility clean and up to date.
reviews.title: Beware! Not worthy of the Holiday Inn name!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately this Holiday Inn Express is none of those things. I left this hotel disappointed with the cleanliness and disrepair only to find my truck had been broken in to!
reviews.title: Just barely average

reviews.text: Stayed her a night after taking Amtrak in and going out on another Amtrak train the next day. We walked about a mile from the Amtrak station to the hotel. I don’t recommend it on a June afternoon, but it was doable for my son and me. It was a Saturday, and there was not much activity on the street.
reviews.title: Nice place.

reviews.text: After a quick, friendly, check in, I walked around the neighborhood to the north. There were abandoned buildings, and the area looked a bit rough, so we did not go far in that direction. We walked around toward the Capitol looking for a place to eat, and there are a few places.
reviews.title: Close to everything.

reviews.text: Next morning, we left early and did not get to check out the breakfast, so I can’t comment on it.
reviews.title: Excellent second stay

reviews.text: Overall, I liked this place. The common areas were all very nice and welcoming. The room was spacious. The window faced the street (the Wells Fargo Pavilion is across the street), and we had some intermittent noise from folks interacting loudly. But not a problem. I couldn’t get the thermostat to work on the air unit, so we just left the fan in the on position and were comfortable. The desk chair had an arm which was unscrewed and unstable, but we didn’t use the chair anyway.
reviews.title: Good!

reviews.text: I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Musky Crap Hotel

description: Experience the Holiday Inn Express in downtown Sacramento, a favorite of both Business and Leisure Travelers, Tour and Convention Groups and considered by many as Sacramento s Best Value . We are centrally located across from the historic Governors Mansion and walking distance to the Sacramento Convention Center, Civic Auditorium, State Capital, Government Offices, Wells Fargo Pavilion, Music Circus, Restaurants, Shopping, Movie Theaters and Starbucks. Convenient to historic 'Old Town Sacramento', Sacramento Jazz Festival, Arden Mall, Cal Expo, Raley Fields, Cal State University, UC Davis, UC Davis Medical Center, Sacramento Zoo, California State Parks, Thunder Valley and Black Oaks casinos. Enjoy our Complimentary Breakfast Bar with a wide variety of hot and cold items while catching up with the news reading your complimentary USA Today. Rooms are beautifully decorated and feature in-room coffee service, hair dryer, irons and ironing boards, on-demand pay movies and free wireless Internet access. We also have a business center, fitness facility and free parking. Pets are welcome and we re a 100% non-smoking, AAA approved hotel.
